pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:0.5_0: The training rule on obstructing one’s finger and then
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.12_0: They burn in times of trouble,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.15_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were clasping their knees while sitting in inhabited areas. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not clasp my knees while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.4_0: One should not clasp one’s knees while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk26:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, clasps his knees with his hands or with a cloth while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
